Geocomputation with R - Benchmark

Robin Lovelace, Jakub Nowosad, Jannes Muenchow

2018-08-14

Source: vignettes/benchmark.Rmd
benchmark.Rmd

Reading vector data

library(sf)
vector_filepath = system.file("shapes/world.gpkg", package = "spData")
world = st_read(vector_filepath)
#> Reading layer `world' from data source `/home/robin/R/x86_64-pc-linux-gnu-library/3.5/spData/shapes/world.gpkg' using driver `GPKG'
#> Simple feature collection with 177 features and 10 fields
#> geometry type:  MULTIPOLYGON
#> dimension:      XY
#> bbox:           xmin: -180 ymin: -90 xmax: 180 ymax: 83.64513
#> epsg (SRID):    4326
#> proj4string:    +proj=longlat +datum=WGS84 +no_defs

To demonstrate this, we will use a function to compare st_read() with its sp equivalent, rgdal::readOGR():

bench_read = function(file, n) {
  m = microbenchmark(times = n,
                     rgdal::readOGR(vector_filepath),
                     st_read(vector_filepath)
  )
  mean(m$time[1:n]) / mean(m$time[(n + 1):(n * 2)])
}

This function takes as arguments an input file (file) and a number of times to run each command (n) and returns how many times faster st_read() is than readOGR(). Let’s run the benchmark for the world.gpkg file represented by the object vector_filepath:

library(microbenchmark)
read_world_gpkg = bench_read(file = vector_filepath, n = 5)
read_world_gpkg
#> [1] 1.606788

The results demonstrate that sf was around 2 times faster than rgdal at reading-in the world countries vector. The relative performance of st_read() compared with other functions will vary depending on file format and the nature of the data. To illustrate this point, we performed the same operation on a geojson file and found a greater speed saving:

vector_filepath_gj = system.file("shapes/cycle_hire_osm.geojson", package = "spData")
read_lnd_geojson = bench_read(file = vector_filepath_gj, n = 5)
read_lnd_geojson
#> [1] 1.467138

In this case sf was around 1 times faster than rgdal.

Writing vector data

library(rgdal)
world_sp = as(world, "Spatial")
system.time(writeOGR(world_sp, dsn = "world_sp.geojson", layer = "world_sp.geojson", driver = "GeoJSON"))
#>    user  system elapsed 
#>   0.052   0.000   0.061
system.time(writeOGR(world_sp, dsn = ".", layer = "world_sp", driver = "ESRI Shapefile")) 
#>    user  system elapsed 
#>   0.008   0.004   0.012
system.time(writeOGR(world_sp, dsn = "world_sp.gpkg", layer = "world_sp.gpkg", driver = "GPKG"))
#>    user  system elapsed 
#>   0.016   0.004   0.019
system.time(st_write(world, "world_sf.geojson", quiet = TRUE))
#>    user  system elapsed 
#>   0.052   0.000   0.052
system.time(st_write(world, "world_sf.shp", quiet = TRUE)) 
#>    user  system elapsed 
#>   0.008   0.000   0.010
system.time(st_write(world, "world_sf.gpkg", quiet = TRUE))
#>    user  system elapsed 
#>   0.016   0.000   0.014
